Platform.Title: PHRI-UMNDJ Mycobacterium tuberculosis 4.8K CAG_Mtb
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: Oligonucleotide 70mer long from the OPERON TB set version 1.0 are spotted using an omnigrid arrayer at a concentration of 25uM in 3x SSC onto glass slides coated with Poly-L-Lysine.

Sample.Title: Sample 1 vancomycin treated 10XMIC 1 hr

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown in physiological conditions to exponential phase
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Culture grown to mid-log phase in Middlebrook 7H9 supplemented with ADC
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Bacteria were thawed on ice and added to prechilled 15 ml screw-capped polypropylene centrifuge tubes containing 1 ml of zirconia/silica beads (0.1 mm diameter, Biospec Products) and 1 ml of phenol-chloroform-isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1). Full details at Manganelli et al. Mol Microbiol (1999) 31:715-724
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Combine total RNA, random primers and reaction mix (5X First-Strand buffer, 100 mM DTT, dTdNTP mix, Cy3 or Cy5). Full details at www.cag.icph.org.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown in physiological conditions to exponential phase and then incubated for 1 hr with 400 ug/ml of vancomycin
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Culture grown to mid-log phase in Middlebrook 7H9 supplemented with ADC
Channel.Extract-Protocol: see channel 1
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: see channel 1

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Combine labeled sample with 10 mg/ml tRNA, 20X SSC, Formamide, % SDS. Full details at www.cag.icph.org
Sample.Scan-Protocol: After hybridization slides were immediately scanned using a 428TMArray Scanner (Affymetrix). Fluorescence intensities of Cy3 and Cy5 dyes at each spot were quantified using the ImaGene software 4.1 (BioDiscovery, Inc.)
Sample.Data-Processing: Values are expressed as ratio Cy5/Cy3 spot's intensity determined from the normalized fluorescence intensity.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: log ratio (ch2/ch1) intensity value normalized with print-tip LOESS

Sample.Title: Sample 1rev vancomycin treated 10XMIC 1 hr

Channel.Characteristics: Mycobacteriun tuberculosis H37Rv strain vancomycin treated
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown in physiological conditions to exponential phase and then incubated for 1 hr with 400 ug/ml of vancomycin

Channel.Label: Cy3

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown in physiological conditions to exponential phase
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Culture grown to mid-log phase in Middlebrook 7H9 supplemented with ADC

Sample.Data-Processing: Data obtained from qualified spots were normalized using the print-tip LOESS with a web-based tool for Diagnosis and Normalization of spotted cDNA MicroArrayData (DNMAD) available at http://dnmad.bioinfo.cnio.es Values are expressed as ratio Cy3/Cy5 spot's intensity determined from the normalized fluorescence intensity.

Column.Name: VALUE

Series.Title: Global transcriptional response to vancomycin in Mycobacterium tuberculosis
Series.Summary: We characterized the variation of M. tuberculosis transcriptional profile in response to inhibitory and subhinibitory concentrations of vancomycin.
Series.Overall-Design: Whole genome microarrays were employed to profile gene expression in M. tuberculosis H37Rv in response to inhibitory or subinibitory concentration of vancomycin. Inhibitory conditions were achieved by exposing bacteria to 400 µg/ml of vancomycin, a concentration exceeding 10 times the minimum inhibitory concentration (10X-MIC); in these conditions bacterial replication arrested rapidly without killing. Subhinibitory conditions were obtained growing the cells in the presence of 5 µg/ml of vancomycin (1/8-MIC) which allowed bacteria to grow with the same profile as untreated cells, although at a reduced rate. Following the addition of vancomycin at a concentartion 10X-MIC, the culture was incubated 1 h, or 4 hrs, and then analyzed to identify which genes were expressed differentially.
